name: BEST WESTERN Angel & Royal Hotel

reviews.text: Late spring bank holiday is not perhaps the best time to stay at a hotel specialising in wedding, but needs must. Room/Suite was good value. Booked breakfast (£7.50), a tad expensive but well worth the price. WiFi only operates around the reception area so if I had have been on a business trip I would rate the hotel a star lower.
reviews.title: Crowded by wedding parties but worth pursuing

reviews.text: Good staff, excellent setting though the stairs are steep and there are plenty of them.
reviews.title: Quiet, quirky place. But very noisy at 0530am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes I will be booking again, as my mates like this old regal glamour to add to their trips to the flat part of UK.
reviews.title: Meal only review

reviews.text: I stayed here for work midweek. Checked in late and the night porter was very helpful and friendly. I was in an annex room which was huge and slightly further down the charming little passage than the main hotel.
reviews.title: Royaly have stayed here so.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly I was woken at five thirty in the morning by a horrendous racket that sounded like somebody dragging an empty skip past the window. A colleague told me that it is somebody collecting bottles or emptying rubbish and had happened the previous night also. At five thirty AM, Ridiculous. To be honest if I were in a Primer Inn I'd have had my money back using the goodnight guarantee. Sadly this is a Best Western so no chance of that.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and good food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived here we thought what a lovely historic building. The receptionist was warm and friendly. Our room was spacious with a dressing room, but....we then found toe nail clippings on the carpet (yeuck!) and then a half drunk bottle of water by the chair. This was reported and apologies made. However, during our 4 night stay the bed was not made - just the duvet pulled across, bottom sheet not tidied. The bed was very comfortable and ornate - with a very thick layer of dust on top of the head board. With no air conditioning I tried to open the windows, eventually giving up and then having to wash my hands as they were so dirty. Free WiFi is advertised and indeed is the case, if you have plenty of time! not if you're trying to work. Impossibly slow. We dined in the Kings Room. What a lovely room - spoiled by stained carpets. Remove them and have wooden floors - so much more in keeping with the room. The food was lovely and well cooked, but the same menu became boring.Such a shame to see this lovely old hotel let down by poor housekeeping as the staff are so friendly and helpful.especially on reception.
reviews.title: Good ...with issues!

reviews.text: Thank you to Jane and her staff for a lovely Sunday Lunch. The food was delicious and the staff were really helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Sunday Lunch

reviews.text: My guests thoroughly enjoyed themselves and I will definitely be planning a return visit.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will also be recommending to friends that they visit for the Sunday Lunch.
reviews.title: historic dining room makes it all worthwhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks again
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Stayed one night and found room clean and spacious. Convenient for town and good parking. An interesting town with a good Nepalese restaurant!. Staff at hotel helpful and attentive. Excellent breakfast!
reviews.title: comfortable town centre hotel

reviews.text: We booked 7 rooms for family to stay over our daughter's wedding weekend. Staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful over the 3 days. We had booked accommodation only, the wedding was elsewhere. Breakfast was excellent quality, as was our meal in the bistro. It was a lovely venue to meet up with friends and family. So much history associated with The Angel. We were very happy with our spacious rooms and would definitely recommend as a great place to stay in the area in future.
reviews.title: Wedding weekend

reviews.text: Had a last minute hotel stay here, really friendly staff, very helpful, nice clean rooms and a good choice at breakfast time.
reviews.title: Nothing to much trouble !

reviews.text: Had been to a reunion so got back to hotel at daft o'clock with some friends, barman opened up for us and we even managed sandwiches at some unearthly hour, made a great weekend even better !
reviews.title: Very nice lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped off on the way to Yorkshire. Had stayed at the hotel many years before and the hotel has seen a good refurb. We eat in the Brasserie downstairs and the food and service was very good. Plan to stay for the weekend in the near future as it looks a very nice place. Plenty of free private parking at back of hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable and friendly hotel in the town centre. The staff were very friendly and helpful, room was large and comfortable, well appointed with a large bathroom and was very clean, the small bar was pleasant with the whole surroundings steeped in history. My only (very) minor gripe is that I would have preferred the residents bar to stay open after 11pm, rather than having to sit in the reception/lounge area and be served by the night porter. However, would we stay again, most definitely Yes.
reviews.title: Lovely historic hotel

reviews.text: The Angel and Royal restaurant was deserted when we arrived today and remained that way for the duration of our meal. It’s a beautiful dining room but would have been better with a few more people in it. I queried with a member of staff why it was so quiet and she said that it’s because they have a reputation for doing a lot of weddings and as a consequence people tend not to consider it on a Saturday for fear of it being pre-booked.
reviews.title: Lovely place, probably even better when busier.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had smoked haddock with bubble and squeak, my wife had a salad and our children fish and chips. All were good, solid meals, well-cooked, ample and spot on for an early autumn day. The food was also very keenly priced and probably the best value we’ve had for some time.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: We had a brief wander round on the ground floor of the hotel and the whole place has a serene feel about it. It’s authentically period, well-maintained and clean with a cheerful and helpful staff. It could just do with being a bit busier than it was today. Maybe next time we’ll try an evening or weekday, but we’ll certainly be back.
reviews.title: Retirement Party

reviews.text: We have just spent 4 nights here and it was great. The reception staff are very kind & helpful, nothing too much trouble. The room ( 103) was lovely with a separate sitting room and TV, the bedroom was large with another TV and the bed very comfortable with lovely white linen. The bathroom was a good size with fluffy towels. All the rooms were spotlessly clean. We ate in the Bistro every evening and the food was first rate. Service excellent apart from 1 evening when an inexperienced young man was on duty. We are sure he will improve... We recommend this great centrally located hotel to all, you will not be disappointed. The manager told us she has ordered name badges,we will then be able to name the people who deserve recognition.
reviews.title: Meeting with friends

aka: Best Western Angel And Royal Hotel
description: Idyllically situated in the ancient market town of Grantham in the south-west corner of Lincolnshire - The Angel and Royal Hotel is an historic hotel - in fact the oldest inn in Britain - and has hosted seven Kings over 800 years - Today the Angel and Royal features an award winning restaurant - cosy fire-lit nooks and bars and modern conference facilities - The individually designed rooms feature modern interiors and colours which complement the magnificent original features of the building - They all offer the facilities required for a comfortable stay including en-suite bathrooms - Freeview TV - phone - internet access - All rooms are no smoking
